docs.snippet: TWO current exhibits at the Newark Museum underline the  democratic, ecumenical spirit of a showplace that displays all kinds of works in an attempt to reach a vast urban public of different backgrounds and styles of life. They also demonstrate th...
docs.lead_paragraph: TWO current exhibits at the Newark Museum underline the democratic, ecumenical spirit of a showplace that displays all kinds of works in an attempt to reach a vast urban public of different backgrounds and styles of life. They also demonstrate that the institution does not follow an inflexible policy of displaying only the traditional high art forms.
docs.abstract: Photographs hon late Rev Dr Martin Luther King Jr by Robert Worth at Newark Museum revd by D L Shirey; illus

docs.lead_paragraph: GOOD FILMS, like good wine, improve with age," said King Vidor, who began his distinguished movie career in 1919 with "The Turn in the Road." Soon the 82-year-old director of such films as "The Big Parade,' "The Crowd," "Hallalujah," "Street Scene," "The Champ," "Our Daily Bread," "Stella Dallas," "The Citadel," ...

headline.main: At the Movies; King Vidor and the Search for Maturity In Today's Films

docs.snippet: "THE DREAM," which was only a twinkle in the eye of the producer Joel Schenker  when he took an option on a book with that title two yeas ago, will finally arrive on Broadway on March 9. "The Dream" was a book by Lucy Freeman that has been rewritt...
docs.lead_paragraph: "THE DREAM," which was only a twinkle in the eye of the producer Joel Schenker when he took an option on a book with that title two yeas ago, will finally arrive on Broadway on March 9. "The Dream" was a book by Lucy Freeman that has been rewritten as a play by Richard Lortz. It is about a detective and an analyst who work together to solve a murder.

headline.main: Broadway; 'The Dream'--a Detective Story With A Freudian Touch

docs.abstract: Songwriters's Hall of Fame to open its museum Jan 18 at 1 Times Sq, NYC, bldg; folk musician Oscar Brand is unpaid curator; memorabilia in hall described; Brand, songwriters Irving Caesar and Johnny Marks and sheet music in museum illus (M)
